metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11490 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The DGifDecompressLine function in dgif_lib.c in GIFLIB (possibly version 3.0.x), as later shipped in cgif.c in sam2p 0.49.4, has a heap-based buffer overflow because a certain "Private->RunningCode - 2" array index is not checked. This will lead to a denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11490` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

giflib-tools - 5.1.4-2ubuntu0.1
libgif7 - 5.1.4-2ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: giflib package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.4-2ubuntu0.1').
